infotexts.jobdescription.clownotrauma_clown: With no real objective other than complete chaos, the Clown is a job for those who want to see the world burn, or watch someone slip on a banana peel.
infotexts.missiondescription.clownotrauma_cargoclo: A local Jestmaster is offering [reward] marks for delivering a shipment of clowning supplies to [location2] for what they say is an upcoming "Show". At least 98% of the Cargo must arrive. Be warned, Clowns have been known to board and rob cargo ships carrying large amounts of Clowning supplies.
infotexts.missionsuccess.clownotrauma_cargoclownge: The clown gear has been successfully delivered. HONK!
infotexts.missiondescription.clownotrauma_abandone: Contact with [location1] was recently lost, and it's suspected to have been taken over by Clowns for one of their "Pranks". Destroy the outpost's reactor to drive them away and ensure they don't return.
infotexts.missionsuccess.clownotrauma_abandonedout: The Clowns were driven away from the outpost successfully.
infotexts.missionmessage0.clownotrauma_abandonedou: The reactor has been destroyed. This should make sure those Clowns won't try to take over the outpost again. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.missiondescription.clownotrauma_abandone: A group of Husk Cultists have claimed [location1] and recently sent out a message in which they demand a ransom for releasing a group of Clowns they're holding hostage. Apparently the Clowns were pranking and profaning their rituals. Clowns never take negotiations seriously, but have promised a considerable reward to anyone who manages to rescue the hostages.
infotexts.missionmessage0.clownotrauma_abandonedou: The Clowns are now all safely on board the sub. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_clownpowe: Become a follower of Honkmotherian teachings. As long as you are wearing a full clown outfit, you gain [afflictionname].
Be sure to spread the Honkmother's word with your ‖color:gui.orange‖Bike Horn‖end‖. She may reward you.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_clownconn: Using your alumni network you can find additional work for your crew. Increases max jobs/missions and special sales by [amount]. Additionally your Clown contacts can help smuggle contraband on board in the form of bikehorns every round.
Honking a ‖color:gui.orange‖Bikehorn‖end‖ at a newly discovered outpost grants you +[amount] reputation with the [faction]. HONK!
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_explosive: People love fireworks, so what's different about explosives? Gain access to homemade explosives that are as dangerous to your enemies as yourself.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_funpolice: Hand buzzers are a great practical prank on the unsuspecting, so what's more unsuspecting than electrified armor? Gain access to some more combat focused abilities to keep you alive.
When wearing ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Armor‖end‖ you stun attackers and take ‖color:gui.green‖80‖end‖ percent reduced damage. ‖color:gui.green‖10‖end‖ second cool down.
You can now also perform the ‖color:gui.orange‖Fun Stun‖end‖ by ragdolling into characters at high speeds.
You take ‖color:gui.green‖15‖end‖ percent less damage but enemies are much more likely to target you.\n\n Ragdolling for more than ‖color:gui.green‖2‖end‖ seconds causes enemies to ignore you.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_humourfou: There's no shortage of sick and injured people on Europa, so why not help them with a dose of humor? You get a PhD in Clown Medicine and gain access to some new skills to help spread the joy. HONK!

You can drag characters at full speed. Hitting an unconscious ally with a ‖color:gui.orange‖Toy Hammer‖end‖ revives them with [affliction] applied for [duration] seconds. Requires ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Power‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_onemanban: Music creates a sense of spectacle and your an expert in spectacles! When playing an ‖color:gui.orange‖Instrument‖end‖ or honking a ‖color:gui.orange‖Bike Horn‖end‖ you give nearby allies a bonus of [skill] to all skills. Once per Mission give crewmembers up to [amount] Experience. You also gain tips from your performance and can earn up to [amount] Marks.

Note: How this works is you have [amount] stacks of Experience and Marks to give when playing and the stacks are based on you, not your crew mates. Make sure they are nearby ([range] Game Units) before playing!
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_masteroft: Leadership is Devotion and since your so devoted to the ‖color:gui.orange‖Way of the Honk‖end‖ you must make a great leader, so why not start your own Circus with the Assistants?
‖color:gui.orange‖Assistants‖end‖ within ‖color:gui.green‖600‖end‖ units of you gain a weaker form of your ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Powers‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_watercome: Being aware of the 4th wall has its perks, like choosing to ignore certain rules of the world. You decide it would be a great prank to be immune to pressure, to the bewilderment of your crew.
Become immune to pressure when under the effects of ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Power‖end‖ and gain [swimspeedvalue]% Swimspeed.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_truestpot: As a master prankster you can tap into the Meta-Physical realm of possibility and probability to play some highly amusing pranks. When under the effects of ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Power‖end‖ you have a [probability]% to implode your target when using any ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Melee‖end‖ weapon.
If under the effects of [entityname.meth] ([afflictionname.haste]) the chance to implode is doubled ([probability]%).
If under the effects of [entityname.steroids] ([afflictionname.strengthen]) there is no limit to the size of what you can implode.
If under the effects of [entityname.meth] ([afflictionname.haste]) and [entityname.steroids] ([afflictionname.strengthen]) both effects apply.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_drhappyvi: By regularly taking Dr. Happy brand vitamins you've built up a tolerance to drug addiction. Sampling the goods never hurt anyone, right?

infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_beastmast: What's a Circus without some exciting and exotic animals? You have learned how to handle friendly monsters better.

infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_thelastla: Comedy is tragedy plus time and you've figured out the crew takes great joy at the idea of your tragic death. You've decided rather than perish you can suprise them with a twist.

When under the effects of ‖color:gui.orange‖Clown Power‖end‖ you rapidly heal normal damage types when you go Unconcious. This can only happen once per mission. When you finally die you are ‖color:gui.orange‖Immune‖end‖ to skill loss on death. infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_inspiring: Nearby allies gain a bonus of [skillamount] to all Skills for [duration] seconds when you honk a ‖color:gui.orange‖Bike Horn‖end‖ or play an ‖color:gui.orange‖Instrument‖end‖. This effect stacks with ‖color:gui.orange‖One Man Band‖end‖.

infotexts.talentdescription.clownotrauma_clowntink: Clown Engineering has always been poorly understood, the fine line between genius and insanity is a thin one.
You can now use a ‖color:gui.orange‖Wrench‖end‖ to tinker with devices.

You can tinker with an engine, increasing its torque by [speedincrease]%.
You can tinker with a loader, increasing the connected turret's firing rate and damage by [damageincrease]%, while lowering its power usage by [powercostreduction]%.
You can tinker with Fabs and Deconstructors, increasing their speed by [speed]%.
The device is only affected for as long as you keep tinkering with it.
You can tinker for [duration] seconds. After you have tinkered with a device, you cannot tinker for [cooldown] seconds.

Honkmother's Clownpendium

Appendix
I. Introduction II. Clowning Around
0. Preface - A note about the mod
Welcome to Clown-O-Trauma! This mod aims to expand greatly upon the Clown context in the base game by making the most fun of classes its own one.
There is a lot of content painstakingly created just for this mod, it has also be Honkmother approved by the Children of the Honkmother.
Finally thanks for trying my mod! If you have any feedback please leave a comment on steam.
With this introduction done let's get started!
I. Introduction
Welcome to the cause!
What makes a good Clown?
It's an interesting question. Many people, including your crew, may think that your existence is simply to annoy or kill them. This usually results in a predisposition to beat or kill you.
Nothing could be further from the truth! Your goal is to instill wonder, amusement and excitment on them! The matter of their mood is irrelevant. What matters is a good show!
In simple terms a good Clown does:
* Do some clever well thought out pranks, a stun grenade wired to a detonator on the bridge door is a good example.
A bad Clown:
* Wires C-4 to a door and kills someone, depriving them of fun themselves.
It is important to ensure that whatever you do, it is something that the humor in it can be seen.
---
II. Clowning Around
You have many tools to amuse yourself and the crew.
These include, but are not limited to:
* Expolsives * Horns * Weapons * Talents * Creatures like the Clown Crawler, Clown Zombies (Smart and Dumb versions). * Reviving dead crew members.
III. Getting started.
Some notes:
* Keep your Clown clothes on at all times if you can, all your talents and some items are tied to the clothes being on. * Your clothes are also your weakness, if they are removed you wont be able to clown around as much. * Keep bikehorns, you need them for a lot of crafting and they cannot be crafted. * Experiment with Blood magic, its very useful. * The Clown Exosuit (Avatar of the Honkmother) is super awesome and is upgradable. It is designed for maximum shits and giggles. * Some talents have side objectives, like honking a bike horn. It is generally worth doing these ASAP as they have useful effects. * While the talent "Truest Potential" may not seem like it's worth it just wait till you get a fast melee weapon, it's a one hit kill (if it pops). * Be warned: you are not the only Child of the Honkmother in the Seas, there are others that have the same talents you do, including the above percent chance to kill on hit. * Wild Sea Clowns are known to board and steal large amounts of Clown cargo being transported, keep an eye out for boarders on such missions.
